benchmark_details.name: Ontology Completion Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a benchmark for evaluating ontology completion methods, designed to include manually validated hard negatives, and thoroughly analyses the strengths and weaknesses of Natural Language Inference (NLI) and concept embedding approaches.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and compare ontology completion methods, specifically analyzing NLI and concept embedding approaches.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The area of ontology completion is considerably less mature than related areas, and the methods analyzed should be seen as baselines for future work.

data.source: Seven well-known ontologies including Wine, Economy, Olympics, Transport, SUMO, FoodOn, and Gene Ontology.
data.size: 103,184 positive examples, 494,708 negative examples in total

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of identifying valid ontology rules.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in identifying valid rules and their classifications.
methodology.baseline_results: Results achieved by various models are provided, showing performance across tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated through comparative analysis of NLI and concept embedding methods.
